section.title: Our First Component
section.description: Lets build our first react component

requirement: Understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Understanding of the latest version of JavaScript (ES6) and its new features such as arrow functions, template literals, and classes.
You should be familiar with package managers such as npm and yarn.
Basic understanding of Git and GitHub as many React projects are hosted on GitHub.
Good problem-solving skills to debug and troubleshoot errors in your code
objective: Gain the ability to build modern, dynamic, and interactive web applications using React's component-based architecture.
Be able to design and develop user interfaces using React's declarative syntax and will become familiar with its virtual DOM and state management concepts
Be able to use React alongside other popular libraries and tools such as Redux, React Router, and Webpack.
Gain Solid understanding of React's concepts, including components, props, state, and lifecycle methods.
Learn to work collaboratively using version control systems such as Git and GitHub
Learn Best practices for building and deploying React applications.
Develop problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and creativity, which are essential in building complex web applications
Gain the ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and frameworks, which are crucial in the fast-paced web development industry
Be proficient in building modern web applications using React and to be prepared for a career in web development

brief: Learn to build web applications using the most popular web framework with the highest job openings.
